body: Yeah, this is why my default assumption is that you shouldn't use subclasses in your design, unless you are ABSOLUTELY CERTAIN that you need the subtyping. In this case, just having CompleteTensorType hold a TensorType inside would have also worked.
body_html: Yeah, this is why my default assumption is that you shouldn't use subclasses in your design, unless you are ABSOLUTELY CERTAIN that you need the subtyping. In this case, just having CompleteTensorType hold a TensorType inside would have also worked.
body_text: Yeah, this is why my default assumption is that you shouldn't use subclasses in your design, unless you are ABSOLUTELY CERTAIN that you need the subtyping. In this case, just having CompleteTensorType hold a TensorType inside would have also worked.
